intro: Ageratina feuereri, commonly known as the Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ageratina feuereri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
